This guide is a simplified overview of '''all non-experimental changes''' in [[The Copper Age]] ({{JE}} 1.21.9 and 1.21.10), which assumes at least some familiarity with [[Chase the Skies]] (''Java Edition'' 1.21.6 to 1.21.8), excluding experimental features in this version.

== Mobs ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}}
|-
|[[Copper golem]]
|{{Animate|Copper Golem.png;Exposed Copper Golem.png;Weathered Copper Golem.png;Oxidized Copper Golem.png|128px}}
|
* Does not spawn naturally. 
* Built with 1 [[carved pumpkin]] or 1 [[jack o'lantern]] and 1 [[block of copper]].
|1–3 [[copper ingots]]
| 
* The copper golem was first announced at [[Minecraft Live 2021]] as a candidate in the [[mob vote]], alongside the [[allay]] and [[glare]].
|-
|}

=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Mobs}}
|-
|[[Happy ghast]]
|[[File:Happy Ghast.gif|150px]]
|
* Is now audible from 64 blocks.
* Riding sound volume is slightly increased.
|-
|[[Iron golem]]
|[[File:Iron Golem JE2 BE2.png|150px]]
|
* Now sometimes plants a decorative flower onto a nearby copper golem.
|}

|

| Pickaxe
| 
* Can be used by copper golems, it will visit up to 10 [[copper chest]]s in sequence to try to take out up to 16 of the first item contained within.
* The search area for copper chests from the copper golem's position is horizontally 32 blocks and vertically 8 blocks.
|-
|[[Copper golem statue]]
|{{Animate|Copper Golem Statue.png;Exposed Copper Golem Statue.png;Weathered Copper Golem Statue.png;Oxidized Copper Golem Statue.png;Copper Golem Statue (Sitting) BE1.png;Copper Golem Statue (Running) BE1.png;Copper Golem Statue (Star) BE1.png;Exposed Copper Golem Statue (Sitting) BE1.png;Exposed Copper Golem Statue (Running) BE1.png;Exposed Copper Golem Statue (Star) BE1.png;Weathered Copper Golem Statue BE1.png;Weathered Copper Golem Statue (Sitting) BE1.png;Weathered Copper Golem Statue (Running) BE1.png;Weathered Copper Golem Statue (Star) BE1.png;Oxidized Copper Golem Statue BE1.png;Oxidized Copper Golem Statue (Sitting) BE1.png;Oxidized Copper Golem Statue (Running) BE1.png;Oxidized Copper Golem Statue (Star) BE1.png|84px}}
| 
* Copper golem statues are created when a copper golem fully oxidizes.
|Any
|
* Interacting with a copper golem statue changes its pose, cycling through four poses: standing, sitting, running, and star.
* Unwaxed copper golem statues have four stages of oxidation. Lightning bolts and axes can remove the oxidation on copper golems statues. Using a honeycomb on a copper golems statues prevents it from oxidizing.
* Using an axe on an unoxidized unwaxed copper golem statue will reanimate it into an unoxidized unwaxed copper golem.
* When they become a statue, they will freeze in a random pose. 
|-
|[[Shelf]]
|{{Animate|Oak Shelf.png;Spruce Shelf.png;Birch Shelf.png;Jungle Shelf.png;Acacia Shelf.png;Dark Oak Shelf.png;Mangrove Shelf.png;Cherry Shelf.png;Pale Oak Shelf.png;Bamboo Shelf.png;Crimson Shelf.png;Warped Shelf.png|84px}}
|

|B1=Matching Stripped Log; Block of Stripped Bamboo; Matching Stripped Stem

|Axe
|
* The shelf can store up to 3 [[item]] stacks (slots).
* While a shelf is powered by [[redstone]], its front texture changes to reflect that it's powered; when placed next to each other, up to 3 powered shelves (of the same wood type) will connect together.
* Shelves can be used as a [[fuel]] in [[furnace]]s, smelting 1.5 items per shelf. Crimson and warped shelves cannot be used as a fuel in furnaces.
|-
|[[Copper bars]]
|{{Animate|Copper_Bars.png; Exposed_Copper_Bars.png; Weathered_Copper_Bars.png; Oxidized_Copper_Bars.png|84px}}
|
{{crafting

|B2=Copper Ingot
|C2=Copper Ingot

|Pickaxe
|
* Functions like the existing [[iron bar]]s.
* Non-waxed copper bars have four stages of oxidation (including the initial normal state). Lightning bolts and axes can remove the oxidation on copper bars. They can be waxed with honeycomb to prevent oxidation from progressing.
* Like other copper blocks, the waxed variant can be obtained by {{ctrl|using}} a honeycomb item on the block.

== Items ==
=== New ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Items}}
|-
|[[Copper pickaxe]]
|[[File:Copper Pickaxe.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|A1=Copper Ingot
|B1=Copper Ingot
|C1=Copper Ingot
|B2=Stick
|B3=Stick
|Output=Copper Pickaxe
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* A copper pickaxe is used to break stone and metal-based materials faster. Breaking a block with a copper pickaxe consumes one use. No durability is consumed for blocks that have a hardness value of 0, such as [[torch]]es and [[flower]]s.
|-
| [[Copper sword]]
| [[File:Copper Sword.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|B1=Copper Ingot
|B2=Copper Ingot
|B3=Stick
|Output=Copper Sword
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* A copper sword is used to deal [[damage]] to mobs and entities by attacking them. A copper sword has {{hp|7}} base damage {{in|be}}, and can be enchanted to deal more damage.
* A copper sword can be also used to destroy certain blocks 50% quicker, sometimes much quicker than with fists.
|-
| [[Copper axe]]
| [[File:Copper Axe.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|A1=Copper Ingot
|A2=Copper Ingot
|B1=Copper Ingot
|B2=Stick
|B3=Stick
|Output=Copper Axe
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* Copper axes can break wood-related blocks faster than other tools. Breaking a block costs 1 durability.
* Using a copper axe on a [[log]], [[wood]] block, or [[block of bamboo]] turns it into a [[stripped log]], [[stripped wood]], or [[block of stripped bamboo]], respectively.
* Using a copper axe on a waxed or oxidized [[copper]] block removes the wax if it has any, or otherwise remove a level of oxidization.
|-
|[[Copper shovel]]
|[[File:Copper Shovel.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|B1=Copper Ingot
|B2=Stick
|B3=Stick
|Output=Copper Shovel
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* A copper shovel can be used to break dirt and soil-type materials faster. When breaking a block, it uses 1 durability. For blocks that break instantly, it uses 0 durability.
* A copper shovel can be also used to create a [[dirt path]] by using the shovel on any one of the blocks.
* A copper shovel can be used to extinguish a [[campfire]].
|-
|[[Copper hoe]]
|[[File:Copper Hoe.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|A1=Copper Ingot
|B1=Copper Ingot
|B2=Stick
|B3=Stick
|Output=Copper Hoe
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* A copper hoe are used to turn dirt, grass blocks, and dirt paths into [[farmland]].
* A copper hoe are also used to harvest various [[plant]] blocks, [[Nether fungi]], and [[sculk]] blocks more quickly.
|-
|[[Copper helmet]]
|[[File:Invicon Copper Helmet.png|84px|class=pixel-image]]
|
{{Crafting
|A1=Copper Ingot
|B1=Copper Ingot
|C1=Copper Ingot
|A2=Copper Ingot
|C2=Copper Ingot
|Output=Copper Helmet
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* When worn, a copper helmet provides {{armor|2}} [[armor points]].
* A copper helmet can be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding [[copper ingot]]s, with each ingot restoring 25% the helmet's maximum durability, rounded down. Two copper helmets can also be combined in an anvil.
* Two damaged copper helmets can be also combined through [[crafting]] or using the [[grindstone]]. The durability of the used copper helmets are added together, plus an extra 5% durability.
|-
|[[Copper chestplate]]
|[[File:Invicon Copper Chestplate.png|84px|class=pixel-image]]
|
{{Crafting
|A1=Copper Ingot
|C1=Copper Ingot
|A2=Copper Ingot
|B2=Copper Ingot
|C2=Copper Ingot
|A3=Copper Ingot
|B3=Copper Ingot
|C3=Copper Ingot
|Output=Copper Chestplate
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* When worn, a copper chestplate provides {{armor|6}} [[armor points]].
* Two damaged copper chestplates can be combined through [[crafting]] or using the [[grindstone]]. The durability of the used copper chestplates are added together, plus an extra 5% durability.
* A copper chestplate can also be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding [[copper ingot]]s, with each ingot restoring 25% the copper chestplates' maximum durability, rounded down. Two copper chestplates of the same tier can also be combined in an anvil.
|-
|[[Copper leggings]]
|[[File:Invicon Copper Leggings.png|84px|class=pixel-image]]
|
{{Crafting
|A1=Copper Ingot
|B1=Copper Ingot
|C1=Copper Ingot
|A2=Copper Ingot
|C2=Copper Ingot
|A3=Copper Ingot
|C3=Copper Ingot
|Output=Copper Leggings
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* When worn, copper leggings provide {{armor|5}} [[armor points]].
* Two damaged pairs of copper leggings can be combined through [[crafting]], using the [[grindstone]] or the [[anvil]]. The durability of the used copper leggings is added together, plus an extra 5% durability.
* A copper leggings can also be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding [[copper ingot]]s, with each ingot restoring 25% the copper leggings' maximum durability, rounded down.
|-
|[[Copper boots]]
|[[File:Invicon Copper Boots.png|84px|class=pixel-image]]
|
{{Crafting
|A2=Copper Ingot
|C2=Copper Ingot
|A3=Copper Ingot
|C3=Copper Ingot
|Output=Copper Boots
|ignoreusage=1
}}
|
* When worn, copper boots provide {{armor|2}} [[armor points]].
* Two damaged pairs of copper boots can be combined through [[crafting]], using the [[grindstone]] or the [[anvil]]. The durability of the used copper boots is added together, plus an extra 5% durability.
* A copper boots can be also repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding units of the [[tiers]]' repair material, with each repair material restoring 25% the boots' maximum durability, rounded down. Two copper boots of the same tier can also be combined in an anvil.
|-
|[[Copper nugget]]
|[[File:Copper Nugget.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|shapeless=1
|1=Copper Ingot
|Output=Copper Nugget,9
|ignoreusage = 1
}}
{{Smelting
|Any copper tools; Any copper armor
|Copper Nugget
}}
|
* Copper nuggets are used to craft [[copper ingot]]s.
* Can be used to craft a copper chain.
* Can be used to craft a copper lantern.
* Can be used to craft a copper torch.
|-
|[[Copper horse armor]]
|[[File:Copper Horse Armor (item) JE1.png|84px]]
|Can be found in the chests of [[monster room|monster rooms]], [[Village/Structure/Blueprints#Weaponsmith 1|weaponsmith's]] houses in [[village|villages]], [[End city|End cities]], [[Nether fortress|Nether fortresses]], [[stronghold|strongholds]], [[jungle pyramid|jungle pyramids]], and [[desert pyramid|desert pyramids]].
|
* Adult [[horse]]s can wear copper horse armor; baby horses, [[donkey]]s, [[mule]]s, [[skeleton horse]]s and [[zombie horse]]s cannot be equipped with armor. When equipped, copper horse armor gives {{armor|4}} [[armor point]]s.
|-
|[[Copper Golem Spawn Egg]]
|[[File:Copper Golem Spawn Egg.png|84px]]
|
* Obtained from the Creative inventory.
|
* Spawns copper golem.
|}

== Gameplay ==
=== Changed ===
{|{{Simple Guide table|Changed Gameplay}}
|-
|[[Sounds]]
|
* Sounds for chests now play at a lower volume.
* The volume at which a sound is played at now respects the sound source volume value.
* The "Voice/Speech" sound source has been renamed to "Narrator/Voice".
* Added new sound events: {{cd|block.copper_chest.open}}, {{cd|block.copper_chest.close}}, {{cd|block.copper_chest_weathered.open}}, {{cd|block.copper_chest_weathered.close}}, {{cd|block.copper_chest_oxidized.open}}, {{cd|block.copper_chest_oxidized.close}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.step}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.hurt}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.death}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.spin}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_weathered.step}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_weathered.hurt}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_weathered.death}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_weathered.spin}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_oxidized.step}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_oxidized.hurt}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_oxidized.death}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_oxidized.spin}}, {{cd|item.armor.equip_copper}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.spawn}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.no_item_get}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.no_item_not_get}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.item_drop}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem.item_no_drop}}, {{cd|entity.copper_golem_become_statue}}, {{cd|block.copper_golem_statue.break}}, {{cd|block.copper_golem_statue.place}}, {{cd|block.copper_golem_statue.hit}}, {{cd|block.copper_golem_statue.fall}}, {{cd|block.copper_golem_statue.step}}, {{cd|block.shelf.activate}}, {{cd|block.shelf.deactivate}}, {{cd|block.shelf.multi_swap}}, {{cd|block.shelf.place_item}}, {{cd|block.shelf.single_swap}}.
* The sound effect produced by an End flash now has a higher delay.
* The [[copper golem]] & [[copper chest]]s are now audible from up to 12 blocks away.
* The copper sorting sounds have been tweaked to be quieter.
|}
